chunks.text: Sometimes when students come to see me they don't seem to have the skills to be able to know what sort of questions to ask.
How can I help them in this situation?
So sometimes when we have emotional pain it's actually really difficult to describe.
It's important to remind the student that they don't have to have an answer immediately.
You need to say things like if this takes a while or it takes you a few attempts to get this out, that's okay.
And sometimes I say to people
that if you can't say everything, just tell me a little bit about what's going on. So just be
really encouraging, and if people don't get it right the first time, it takes a bit of time,
that's okay. It might take several attempts to get their message across.
